Posts.Content:
Hi Thinkspos,
It is better to think positive, I pray your follow up in November will be good. I know when they told me to come back in 6 months it was always in the back of my mind and I just didn't feel like myself. I didnt laugh as often and didn't smile as much. I know that I shouldn't have let it get to me but i did. Now that I went back for my follow up back in April and it was ok I thought to myself what a waste of worry. Even though I go today for my regular mamo, I am a little nervous but i'm not worried. 
I work in the retail industry and some of the things that they put out there for breast cancer awareness makes you think "What were they thinking" a dish scrubber and a dog toy for breast cancer awareness are you kidding. I just like the subtle stuff like the pink wristband or a nice tee shirt.
Posts.Title: Thinking Positive is all I can do right now

Posts.Content:
I go tomorrow to have my regular Mamogram. Just a little apprehensive because my last Mamo I had got a call back to do a diagnostic mamo and ultrasound. They said they thought it was a cyst and to come back in six months. I went back in April and everything was fine. For those six month all I thought about
 was could I have cancer. I was not myself during that time.
Posts.Title: apprehensive

Posts.Content: Thanks for the virtual hug it really helps. I'm sending you a virtual hug back. I'm sure everything will be ok for you in November. I will keep you in my prayers. I'm sure everything will be ok today. You are right, worring doesnt do a bit of good just gives you more wrinkles. :)
Posts.Title: apprehensive

Posts.Content: I hope that everything went ok. I was 14 or 15 when i found a lump on my left breast, went to the doctor and he said that it was an infected milk gland. The infection made my breast swell so big, it was the first and last time that I had a big boob:). Everything turned out ok. I am now 45.
Posts.Title: worryed

Posts.Content: I'm 45 been having mammos forever it seams, this past September I had a call back to do a diagnostic mammo and ultra sound. Took a long time to read it and then said that everything looked ok and said we will see you in six months. I went back yesterday for my six months check up, the x-ray tech said that if they need to see me sooner they will let me know but otherwise they would see me in six months for my regular mammo. I was wondering does the radiologist let you know when your there if you would need a biopsi. My mom had breast cancer. They caught it extremely early and she just had to do radiation. I hate this waiting. Cant they just let you know while your there!
Posts.Title: (No Subject)

Posts.Content: I had both the diagnostic mammogram and the ultrasound on April 4th for my 6 month check up and also back in October on my first call back. I guess I'm just paranoid. I just wasnt sure if the Radiologist tells you something right away or send the report to your doctor so your doctor can tell you.
Posts.Title: (No Subject)
